alert.note: Alert for Candler; Evans; Inland Liberty; Inland McIntosh; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 6:55AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...REMAIN ALERT FOR PATCHY FREEZING FOG ON ROADS AND OTHER PAVED SURFACES THIS MORNING... With temperatures below freezing and shallow, but patchy fog developing in a few places, black ice could occur on a few roads and other paved surfaces across parts of interior Georgia through 9 AM. Icy spots could form on paved surfaces such as bridges and overpasses, primary and secondary roads, parking lots, sidewalks and driveways. Black ice is difficult to see and distinguish from dry surfaces. The deceptive nature of black ice can catch you unaware while you are driving or walking, causing you to lose control of your motor vehicle or to slip and fall.
info.instruction: If you plan to drive or walk, remain alert for black ice. Slow your driving speed and use care when walking on sidewalks, driveways or parking lots. Slips and falls constitute a leading cause of injuries during winter weather.

area.areaDesc: Candler; Evans; Inland Liberty; Inland McIntosh; Long; Tattnall
